register.description: The Buffer Register defines the pointer for the external buffer.

bitfield.description: The base address for the external buffer, lower 32 bits.

register.description: The Buffer Register defines the pointer for the external buffer.

bitfield.description: The base address for the external buffer, upper 16 bits.

register.description: The Target Register defines the pointer for the external target.

bitfield.description: The base address for the external target, lower 32 bits.

register.description: The Target Register defines the pointer for the external target.

bitfield.description: The base address for the external target, upper 16 bits.

register.description: The Buffer OrderID Register contains the bus value for the buffer memory access.

bitfield.description: Indicates to replace the bus OrderID value for the buffer access with the ORDERID register field. 0 = bypass and use the OrderID from the source transaction for the destination transaction. 1 = use the ORDERID register field value for the destination transaction.
Defines the bus OrderID value for the buffer access.

register.description: The Control Register defines controls for proxy thread a. Offset = 1000h + (j * 1000h); where j = 0h to 9Fh for NAVSS0_SEC_PROXY0_CFG_SCFG j = 0h to 59h for MCU_NAVSS0_SEC_PROXY0_CFG_SCFG

bitfield.description: Direction for the proxy thread. 0 = outbound, write only. 1 = inbound, read only.
Max message count allowed for an outbound proxy thread. Is not used otherwise.
Queue number in the target to use for the proxy thread. If the target base does not start at queue 0 then this is the relative queue number from that base queue.

register.description: The Event Map Register defines the event numbers for proxy thread a. Offset = 1004h + (j * 1000h); where j = 0h to 9Fh for NAVSS0_SEC_PROXY0_CFG_SCFG j = 0h to 59h for MCU_NAVSS0_SEC_PROXY0_CFG_SCFG

bitfield.description: Event number for an error from the proxy thread.
Event number for a threshold event from the proxy thread.

register.description: The Destination Register defines the destination proxy thread for outbound proxy thread a. Offset = 1008h + (j * 1000h); where j = 0h to 9Fh for NAVSS0_SEC_PROXY0_CFG_SCFG j = 0h to 59h for MCU_NAVSS0_SEC_PROXY0_CFG_SCFG

bitfield.description: The proxy thread that is the destination of messages from this outbound proxy thread, based on the queue numbers. This is ignored for inbound proxy threads.
